intro: Acrachne eleusinoides, commonly known as the wild barley or goat's beard, is a flowering plant in the grass family, Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is native to regions of Africa, Asia, and Europe, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Acrachne eleusinoides is typically annual, completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
